intro: Ceruana pratensis, commonly known as the meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ceruana pratensis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
